intro: Sporobolus richardsonis, commonly known as the sand dropseed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its fine, grass-like foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in prairie and steppe habitats. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions. Sporobolus richardsonis plays an important role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
